title: 2018 EPA Radnet reporting Boise, ID

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2018 EPA Radnet reporting Boise, ID
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, documents, correspondence, materials, presentations, reports, and data concerning missing/unreported RadNet system data from stationary air monitors located in Boise, ID between November 15, 2018, and November 27, 2018.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Michael Hill

title: FOIA - FBI - William Durant

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - William Durant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning William James Durant (November 5, 1885 – November 7, 1981) - American historian and philosopher (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_Durant )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Education for ICE detainees

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Education for ICE detainees
communications.communication:
July 11, 2023

Patrick C. Lee
General Counsel
Plymouth County Sheriff
24 Long Pond Road
Plymouth, MA 02360

Dear Mr. Lee, 

This is a request under the Massachusetts Public Record Law (M.G.L. Chapter 66, Section 10). I am requesting that I be provided a copy of the following records: 

1. Any policies or procedures that dictate what educational and programmatic services are offered to Federal Detainees and ICE Detainees within Plymouth Sheriff’s custody.

2. Records that indicate what educational services (including but not limited to K-12 education, Special Education, Vocational Education, High School Equivalency, or post-secondary education), if any, were provided to federal detainees and ICE detainees  from January 2021 through the date that this request is responded to. We request records that show the age of the detainee who received educational services, and the type of educational services provided. If no educational services were provided during this time, a statement to that effect would be appreciated.


The Public Records law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days.  I would appreciate an electronic response via email.  Thank you, in advance.

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Citizens for Juvenile Justice
44 School St. Suite 415,
Boston, MA 02108
617-338-1050

Location: 2000-BLK E 12th St

For the purpose of this request, I kindly request the following records related to each arrest incident:

The official incident report(s) related to each arrest, including any supplementary reports or narratives detailing the circumstances and events leading to the arrest.

Any records of communication (such as dispatch logs, radio transmissions, or officer notes) pertaining to the response, arrest, and subsequent handling of each incident.

Copies of any audio or visual recordings, including but not limited to dashcam footage, body-worn camera footage, or surveillance footage, associated with the arrests in question.

Any available 911 audio recordings or transcripts related to the incidents.

Any written statements or interviews conducted by law enforcement officers or witnesses regarding the incidents.

Any records documenting the collection and preservation of physical evidence related to the arrests.

Copies of any arrest warrants, search warrants, or bench warrants issued in relation to the aforementioned charges.

To support my request, I refer to the following state and federal court cases that recognize the public's right to access court documents and law enforcement records under the Freedom of Information Act:

Nixon v. Warner Communications, Inc., 435 U.S. 589 (1978): This case affirmed the public's right to access court records under the common law and recognized the role of the media in informing the public.

Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court, 478 U.S. 1 (1984): This case established that the public has a constitutional right under the First Amendment to attend criminal proceedings and access court documents.

Richmond Newspapers, Inc. v. Virginia, 448 U.S. 555 (1980): This case recognized the public's right of access to criminal trials under the First Amendment.

United States v. Mitchell, 551 F.2d 1252 (D.C. Cir. 1976): This case established that the public has a right of access to pretrial motions and exhibits.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document or recording is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

I request the following records:

Court Documents:
a) Charging documents: Please provide the complaint or indictment filed against Andrew James Smith, including any supporting affidavits or statements submitted.

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) to request access to and copies of all records and documents pertaining to the ongoing criminal case against Karl Houston Walls, a former teacher at Northeast High School in Pasadena, Anne Arundel County.

Mr. Walls has been charged with numerous criminal offenses, including but not limited to second-degree rape, cause to ingest bodily fluids, perverted practice, sexual solicitation of a minor, sex abuse of a minor, fourth-degree sex offense of a person of authority (4 counts), second-degree assault (three counts), dangerous weapon with intent to injure, fourth-degree sex offense by person of authority and second-degree assault.

The records sought include, but are not limited to, police reports, witness statements, charges filed, arrest records, court transcripts, evidence such as body cam video or interrogation footage, text messages and photographs/videos allegedly sent by Mr. Walls to the victims, and any other pertinent documents related to this case.

In addition, we are interested in any records relating to off-school property incidents involving Mr. Walls, specifically an incident where he allegedly held a knife against one of the students.

The public has a significant interest in these records due to the gravity of the charges and the involvement of a person in a position of authority over minors in a school setting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Citizen

title: DASNY's Role in the Development of New York's Cannabis Marketplace

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: DASNY's Role in the Development of New York's Cannabis Marketplace
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I am requesting access to and copies of records related to the Dormitory Authority of the State of New York's (DASNY) role in the development of the state's cannabis marketplace, specifically the Conditional Adult-Use Retail Dispensary (CAURD) program and the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund.

The specific records I seek include, but are not limited to:

1. The number of DASNY staff members allocated to the CAURD program or cannabis-related activities.
2. The portion of DASNY's budget allocated to the cannabis program.
3. Updated figures on the expenditure of the state's $50 million pledge for the CAURD program.
4. Details of the $5 million loan program announced in June 2023, including its source of funding.
5. The updated term sheet for Social Equity Impact Ventures' involvement in the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund, including details of the management fee.
6. All communications, contracts, and agreements related to the selection of Chicago Atlantic as the investor for the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund.
7. Any records related to the questions listed in the article "The questions DASNY will not answer about NY cannabis" published on Syracuse.com.

Please note that according to the New York State Archives' General Retention and Disposition Schedule for New York State Government Records (LGS-01), many of these records should be retained and available for public access.

If any of the requested records are not available or are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation for each individual record denied or redacted, citing the specific statutory exemption(s) you believe justify the refusal to release the information.

I look forward to your prompt response within five business days, as required by law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: The no-contact police order issue by Sergeant Bruce Hume with arrest threat - Norwalk PD, Wilton PD and Gilbert AZ PD (Norwalk Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please produce any and all documents, records or other materials discoverable under your State's rules of civil and criminal discovery.

Primarily I seek to know the date that the perpetual arrest threat was withdrawn that has obstructed justice in probate cases in Stratford Probate Court involving executor Sergeant Bruce Hume and beneficiary Scott Huminski.
 
The conduct is described in detail here in this sworn court filing,
https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_request_attachments/s_huminski%40live.com/31910/Removal_Contempt_Protective_order_merged.pdf

The conduct is an extreme violation of State and Federal criminal law related to obstruction of justice, service of court papers and an interstate conspiracy between multiple law enforcement agencies.

As the above link memorialized in sworn content, there was a nefarious conspiracy to obstruct justice between the police departments of Norwalk CT, Wilton Ct and Gilbert AZ which continues to obstruct a current case before the Stratford Probate Court in the estate of Dorothy Blotney.  Notorious official white collar crime engineered by a Sergeant with the Norwalk Police (Identity withheld).  See muckrock link above.

Sworn court filing also attached.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

scott huminski

title: E-470 Public Highway Authority Contract Staff Names, Titles, and Hourly Rates

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: E-470 Public Highway Authority Contract Staff Names, Titles, and Hourly Rates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For each contractor, temporary employee, and/or contingent worker contracted with the E-470 Public Highway Authority, for any time between January 1, 2023, to the date of this requests filing.
       Full legal given name(s) and surname(s) of each individual.
       Title or role held by each individual during their contract period.
       Contract or hourly rate paid to the employee's employer for each individual. Additionally, please provide the rate provided to the employee (if different from the employer's rate).
       The employing agency or business name associated with each individual.

I understand no single given record may contain all of the above information. Please provide any combination of documents necessary to provide the requested information. I am not requesting the creation of any new records. 

Please note, Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S § 24-72-203(3.5)(d) : Altering an existing public record, or excising fields of information pursuant to this subsection (3.5) to remove information that the custodian is either required or permitted to withhold, does not constitute the creation of a new public record.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Full legal given name(s) and surname(s) of each individual. 
Title or role held by each individual during their contract period. 
Contract or hourly rate paid to the employee's employer for each individual. Additionally, please provide the rate provided to the employee (if different from the employer's rate). 
The employing agency or business name associated with each individual. 
I understand no single given record may contain all of the above information. Please provide any combination of documents necessary to provide the requested information. I am not requesting the creation of any new records. 
Please note, Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S § 24-72-203(3.5)(d) : Altering an existing public record, or excising fields of information pursuant to this subsection (3.5) to remove information that the custodian is either required or permitted to withhold, does not constitute the creation of a new public record. 
This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
Advocate

communications.communication:

07/07/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148899 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013906-070723 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 
Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R001284-070623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/07/2023 

Rose Terse 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148894 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 06, 2023, Reference # R001284-070623 

Dear Rose Terse, 

This letter is to inform you that your public records request was received in this office on July 06, 2023. 

Unfortunately your request does not identify a specific record. As per RCW 42.56.520(3)(a) since your request for records is unclear our office will not be able to accept your public records request as written, we require clarification before searching for any records. 
Please clarify the following: What Department or Office are you wishing to receive records from? Your request currently reads "All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office." Ferry County Public Records does not hold or maintain a Brady List but the Ferry County Prosecuting Attorney's Office may. 

A request under the Public Records Act must be for an identifiable public record, see Hangartner v. City of Seattle, 151 Wn.2d 439, 447-48, 90 P.3d 26 (2004), and a mere request for information does not so qualify. Wood v. Lowe, 102 Wn.App. 872, 879, 10 P.3d 494 (2000); Bonamy v. City of Seattle, 92 Wn.App. 403, 410-12, 960 P.2d 447 (1998), review denied, 137 Wn.2d 1012 (1999). Local governments are not required to create documents in order to comply with a request for specific information. Citizens for Fair Share v. State Dep’t of Corrections, 117 Wn.App. 411, 435, 72 P.3d 206 (citing Smith v. Okanogan County, 100 Wn.App. 7, 13-14 (2000)). See also WAC 44-14-04003(5). Nor are local governments obligated to compile information from various records so that information is in a form that is more useful to the requestor. Instead, they must produce existing records for review and copying. 

As per RCW 42.56.520(3)(b) if you fail to respond to our request for clarification within 15 days from the date of this letter, we will presume your request has been abandoned and we will close our file. 

Sincerely, 
Marah Hulse 
Ferry County Public Records Officer

title: National Archives records: Brigid Berlin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: National Archives records: Brigid Berlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

According to news reports, she was born Brigid Emmett Berlin in Manhattan on Sept. 6, 1939. I request that you use those details to augment your search.

A previous FOIA request with the FBI indicated that, "Records potentially responsive to your request were transferred to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)."

The FBI said to use file number 94-HQ-4-4467 as a reference.

https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-file-brigid-berlin-148599/#files

I ask that those files, and any other held by your agency, be released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: National Archives records: Brigid Berlin
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
FOIA@nara.gov.  Your request concerns FBI file 94-HQ-4-4467.

Our office handles FOIA and Privacy Act requests for the NARA's
operational records
(records created by this agency).  Since your request is for archival
records (records created by or originated in a different agency, but that
may have been transferred to the legal custody of NARA) to which access may
be restricted, we are forwarding it by this email to our Office of Research
Services, Special Access and FOIA staff who handle FOIA requests for such
archival records.

That office will assign your request a tracking number, and respond
directly to you.  In the future, if you need to follow up with that office,
please contact them at the address below, or electronically via email
(email is preferred).

The National Archives and Records Administration
Special Access and FOIA Staff (RF)
8601 Adelphi Road, Room 5500
College Park, MD 20740

Phone: 301-837-3190
Fax: 301-837-1864
Email: specialaccess_foia@nara.gov

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia  for further information
about making a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website, www.archives.gov,
you can learn more about the resources that we offer to the public, and you
can access our online catalog.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA had adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff. As a result of this re-prioritization of activities, you may
experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your FOIA
request.  We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your
understanding and patience.

Sincerely,
Ashley Bryan
Government Information Specialist
Office of General Counsel (NGC)
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

title: FOIA - Vernon Hills PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Vernon Hills PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to Flock Safety (https://www.flocksafety.com) license-plate-reader hardware and/or software. Documents being requested here should include - but are not limited to - the following:

- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service
- MOUs from Flock Safety
- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety
- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services
- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"
- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services

I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.dailyherald.com/news/20230623/vernon-hills-plans-to-deploy-17-license-plate-reading-cameras-to-combat-organized-retail-crime

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
